alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 1:35PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Rivers draining the Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from rainfall may result in minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Water will cover gravel bars, increased debris will be coming downriver, and erosion is likely along some riverbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Between 1 to 1.5 inches of rain is expected between Monday afternoon through Wednesday across the Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway to the Alcan border. Some locations may see higher amounts. Runoff from this rainfall may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly to bankfull and possibly overbank. This includes the Chandalar, Sheenjek, and Colleen Rivers and their tributaries. - Weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Those living or recreating in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
